channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How a Black fossil digger became a superstar in the very white world of paleontology
item.description: In South Africa, paleontology has been dominated by white people. Lazarus Kgasi is changing that dynamic — and coloring in the picture of the world ou...

item.title: Photos: Scenes from the 150th Westminster Dog Show
item.description: Hundreds of dogs competed for the top prize at the Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show this week. Penny the Doberman pinscher was named best in show.

item.title: Greetings from Kyiv, where candles are the last option during wartime blackouts
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

item.title: Congress faces tight deadline to fund DHS. And, Ryan Routh faces sentencing
item.description: Congress ended the shutdown, but now faces a tight deadline to fund the Department of Homeland Security. And, the man convicted of attempting to assas...

item.title: Bezos orders deep job cuts at 'Washington Post'
item.description: The Washington Post embarked on severe cuts despite appeals by the newsroom to owner Jeff Bezos. The paper is to narrow its focus largely to politics ...

item.title: Fears of new arms race as US-Russia nuclear weapons treaty due to expire
item.description: The New Start treaty has limited the number of deployed strategic nuclear warheads for both countries.

item.title: 700 members of federal law enforcement will be pulled from Minnesota immediately, Homan says
item.description: President Trump's border czar announced that 700 federal law enforcement agents will depart from Minnesota as he boasted about a unified chain of comm...

item.title: Ukrainians remain defiant as Russia targets infrastructure during winter
item.description: Ukrainians are reeling from a frigid winter but remain defiant as Russia continues to target infrastructure. CBS News' Aidan Stretch has more.

item.title: Leader of South Africa's second largest party to step down
item.description: The surprise move may threaten the stability of the coalition government of which the DA is a key partner.

item.title: No suspect identified in disappearance of Savannah Guthrie's mom
item.description: The disappearance of "Today" show co-host Savannah Guthrie's mother, Nancy Guthrie, is being investigated as a crime.

item.title: Fall in love with these Valentine's Day book recommendations
item.description: Amazon Books' editorial director Sarah Gelman joins "CBS Mornings" with some favorite book recommendations for Valentine's Day.

item.title: Thousands without power in freezing Ukraine as renewed Russian strikes continue
item.description: Ukraine's leader says regions including Kyiv and Kharkiv are among those suffering the most from blackouts as a result of recent attacks.

item.title: Son of Norway's crown princess holds back tears giving evidence at rape trial
item.description: Marius Borg Høiby gives evidence after the first woman he is alleged to have raped told the court she believed she had been drugged.

item.title: Ex-Prince Andrew moves out of royal home amid new Epstein revelations
item.description: King Charles' disgraced brother Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor moves from his royal mansion to a private estate after appearing in newly released Epstein ...

item.title: Israeli strikes kill 20 in Gaza, hospitals say, after soldier wounded by gunfire
item.description: Hospitals say several children were among those killed in strikes that Israel's military says it launched after a gun attack on its troops.

item.title: Signs of forced entry found at Arizona home of ‘Today’ show host Savannah Guthrie’s mother
item.description: Investigators have found signs of forced entry at the Arizona home of “Today” show host Savannah Guthrie’s mother.

item.title: Savannah Guthrie says her mom is a woman of faith and a source of strength for the family
Immigration agents draw guns and arrest activists following them in Minneapolis
